title: (x) "Soar to new heights" Western type font - Mesquite {Lex}
content:
Not sure what font or fonts these are. I did a search and the only thing I could come up with was High Country but I couldn’t tell if it was the right font or not.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SoaroNewHeights_3732.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Waters fancy serif face - Irvin (similar to NewYorkerType) {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35289 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bed Head distressed typewriter font - VT Corona {Paul H} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35259 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rosenj4

comments.content:
Looks like Mesquite to me. I’ll check.

- Lex

[Here’s Mesquite.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/mesquite_std/&sample_text=SOAR%20TO%20NEW%20HEIGHTS&sample_size=74) I seem to remember another font that looked similar. Maybe it’s wider. Otherwise, it might be stretched horizontally.

- Lex

The other one I was thinking of was High Noon, but it’s just as narrow. I’m gonna bet your sample is Mesquite since it has no lowercase, and Mesquite is bundled with some Adobe products.

- Lex

Yeah, the [squooshing](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/squoosh) would explain the odd shapes. If you want a nice western face that isn’t so condensed, there’s [Council](http://web.archive.org/web/20071102154416/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/emigre/council/).

Thanks!

And the word SOAR has just been reformatted in illustrator or something? Is there any quick way to get that effect or would you have to tweak it by hand?

If you tweak it by hand, you can get a much nicer result than the above, which looks like a standard Illustrator effect. I think there’s a “warp” tool in Illustrator, but I’m a CorelDraw user, so I don’t know.

- Lex
